result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:52 PM Defendant Derrick Deion Hutchins in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Jedidiah J Dodge for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Derrick Deion Hutchins. 

3:53 p.m. Officer N Barker is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Jambois. 
Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Jambois.
3:54 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
3:55 p.m.  ADA Jambois references exhibit #P1.
ADA Jambois would move exhibit #P1 into evidence, subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Soule.  Received by the Court.
3:58 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Soule.
3:59 p.m.  ADA Jambois has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Jambois has no further questions or witnesses.
Atty Soule has no witnesses.
ADA Jambois gives his final argument.
Atty Soule has no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Request from the Defendant in re:  reduction of Bond 
sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 06/16/22 sp

1:09 PM Defendant Derrick Deion Hutchins appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Taylor Soule in court.
Atty Cassidy calls the case and states appearances. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of 3 counts of misdemeanor battery and strangulation.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule states objections as to bond as stated on record.
Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Absolutely no contact with S.E.G. or her residence as stated on record.
May come upon residence one time with law enforcement to gather items.
